data.question: What is the main purpose of inserting CO2 into aryl C-H bonds of MOFs?
data.answer: To generate free carboxylate groups for efficiently catalyzing the methanolysis of epoxides.

data.question: Which MOF was selected for the study of CO2 insertion into aryl C-H bonds?
What is the role of the carboxylate group generated in the MOF after CO2 insertion?
data.answer: It serves as a Brønsted acid site for catalysis.

data.question: True or False: The insertion of CO2 into the MOF's aryl C-H bonds was proven by 13C NMR spectroscopy.
What was the yield of the CO2 insertion reaction on UiO-67(dcppy)?
True or False: UiO-67(dcppy)-COOH can be recovered and reused as a heterogeneous catalyst.
What was the yield of methanolysis of the epoxide when catalyzed by UiO-67(dcppy)-COOH?
True or False: The parent UiO-67(dcppy) showed a higher yield than UiO-67(dcppy)-COOH in the methanolysis of epoxides.
What was the main challenge in directly activating a CO2 molecule for C-C bond formation?
data.answer: The inertness of CO2 makes it a formidable challenge to directly activate and form a C-C bond, especially under mild reaction conditions.

data.question: True or False: The study presents the first example of utilizing CO2 for direct solid-state C-H activation and carboxylation reactions on a MOF.
What was the BET surface area of UiO-67(dcppy) after CO2 insertion?
True or False: The insertion of CO2 into the MOF's aryl C-H bonds resulted in a decrease in the MOF's BET surface area.
What was the role of methylrhodium(I) in the CO2 insertion process?
data.answer: It acted as a catalytic species to promote the insertion of CO2 into the aryl C-H bond.

data.question: True or False: The reaction mechanism for CO2 insertion into the MOF's aryl C-H bonds is similar to that of a homogeneous reaction system.
What was the outcome when using UiO-67(dcppy)-COOH for ring-opening of trans-stilbene oxide?
data.answer: No activity was observed due to the size-selective pore size and volume of UiO-67(dcppy)-COOH.

data.question: True or False: The study advances a new application of CO2 as a C1 building block.
What was the main inspiration behind inserting CO2 into the aryl C-H bond of MOFs?
data.answer: The tremendous progress recently made in the field of C-H functionalization/activation in homogeneous systems.

data.question: True or False: The study provides a different perspective for CO2 utilization on the MOF platform.
What was the main finding from the NH3 temperature-programmed desorption (TPD) analysis?
data.answer: UiO-67(dcppy)-COOH displayed an extra desorption peak at about 450 K, corresponding to NH3 bound to stronger Brønsted acid sites.

data.question: What does the successful insertion of CO2 into the MOF's aryl C-H bonds signify for future research?
data.answer: It opens new avenues for CO2 chemical transformations under mild reaction conditions and enriches the current landscape of CO2 capture and transformation.
